intro.description: Here you will learn the basics on snapshots and memory analysis. We will focus on heap dumps only, the most complete type of snapshot.

item.title: Open the heap dump
item.description:
From the main menu, select File > Open Snapshot,
then select a heap dump and press Open.
In this cheat sheet we will use a sample heap dump. Please open it by activating the action link below.

item.title: Open Class Histogram
item.description:
Class Histogram shows the classes found in the snapshot, the number of objects for each class, the heap memory consumption of these objects, and the minimum retained size of the objects. To open the view press
Open Class Histogram
toolbar button.

item.title: Sort histogram by classloader
item.description:
To see the histogram sorted by classloaders select the
Group by classloader
combobox toolbar button. To return to the initial sorting select the Group by class option of the same combobox.

item.title: Compare two snapshots
item.description:
To compare two snapshots open a baseline snapshot and a later snapshot and press the
Show differences
toolbar button, and select the baseline snapshot to see the differences.

item.title: Export histogram data
item.description:
To export the histogram sorted by classes or classloaders press the
Export
combobox toolbar button. Now you can choose among HTML, CSV and TXT export formats.
To copy the selection to the clipboard press
Ctrl-C
or use the context menu action.
item.onCompletion: Congratulations! You have learned how to perform the basic analysis of the heap dump.
